text:
If the URL begins with "https" and is missing a trailing slash after a directory
name, the redirection that results will use "http" rather than "https".  Note
also that my example is a NameVirtualHost.  The directory "foo" does not exist
in the regular http area, so you'll get a "not found" error.

The "http" or "https" should be preserved when rewriting with the slash.

text:
I have a similar problem, except in my case Apache is converting http to 
https.  I have pared down a http.con, and removed my virtual hosts, as well as 
most to the LoadModule statements.

These both look like configuration errors.

For the first config file attached, there is *no* "SSLEngine On" configured; I
can't see how SSL would not at all in this config.

In the second config file attached, "SSLEngine On" is configured in global
context, so, unsurprisingly, even for plain HTTP access you'll get redirects to
https://.

See http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/mod/mod_ssl.html#sslengine
for correct use of SSLEngine, or try users@httpd.apache.org for further help.
